Storage Server Key Concepts - Page Environment

The storage server is a simple Web API wrapper around sessionStorage. It provides CRUD for collections of json objects, and is used to keep user configuration and application data.

  • /
    • GET: Provides a map of collection names to arrays of item ids in the collections
    • POST: Generates a new collection with a unique id, which it returns
  • /:collection
    • GET: Provides an array of item ids in the collection
    • POST: Adds the given item to the collection. If id is not given, generates a unique id.
    • DELETE: Removes the collection and its items.
  • /:collection/:item
    • GET: Provides the requested item.
    • PUT: Overwrites the item at the given URI, creating if DNE.
    • PATCH: Updates the item at the given URI, responding 404 if DNE.
    • DELETE: Deletes the item.
